intro: Amphineurion velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cichorioideae. It is characterized by its velvety, soft leaves and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean, this plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in maritime environments. Its unique morphology makes it a distinctive addition to coastal flora, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. The plant's ability to tolerate salt spray and strong winds contributes to its ecological significance in coastal ecosystems.
